comments.body: Yes! I think cats and ocelots should take naps at day when other animals sleep at night. Baby animals also would sleep more than adults.
Ducks should have the green heads. Also, chickens should be altered to have a more robust model. They should also be able to peck the ground
More bird mobs would be fantastic!

I found out today i had to get rid of my ducks and chickens and cuz minecraft already has chickens i was hoping the developers cpuld consider ducks my brothers currently really upset about the ducks and i wanted to cheer him up by saying they added ducks to minecraft at some point i just feel like it would really help him to get over the ducks being gone.
I personally think they should be MORE aggressive. WaBAM! Goats!
less aggressive but still ram unprovoked, but when provoked, that's a tale best forgotten

I think so, too.
I think this way.
Pigs can find nearby food-smelling gestures and truffles in the soil, or, as in Minecraft Earth, soaking in mud can change their texture.
Cows live in groups.
In addition to slow movements, it also flies, bounces and runs when it feels good.
They eat grass like sheep, but if there is nothing, they lie down and relax.
Sheep live in groups, and when one panics, the other sheep also panic and run away all at once.
And with a low probability, "Horned Sheep", which is also in Micra Earth, will appear in the group of sheep, but it will be neutral to protect the sheep.
Chickens build nests where they lay their eggs.
And they have a habit of bathing in the sand, poking the ground and grass, exploring and looking for food.
Wolves act in groups, and in addition to rabbits, foxes, skeletons and their variants, llamas, sheep and turtles, chickens, goats, pigs and cows are also hunted.
And when the full moon comes, it howls.
Ocelots are good at swimming, climbing trees, and hunting parrots as well as chickens and turtles.

I agree! If horses cannot swim (which irl they can.. why can other animals swim but horses cannot??) I think that there should at least be a way to transport your horses via water. I think a bigger boat would be great! Maybe a separate crafting recipe (two boats crafted together)
What if drowned is afraid of the glow squid? Or he seemed hypnotized and his gaze focused on the glow squid for a while.

I was going to create my own post, however I do not want to risk it being taken down for being too similar to this. My functionality idea for the glow squid is luminescence. Using a bucket on a glow squid will collect it's luminescence and revert it to a regular squid (similar to shearing a mooshroom). The bucket of luminescence will act as a mobile light source in item form (similar to some torch mods). The catch is that the luminesence will eventually run out (indicated by a durability bar) and turn back into a water bucket. I think this would make a nice compromise for the players who request that torches emit light when carried or to add a mining helmet.
Maybe you can use the fluorescent pearls to change the enchantment glint color of your gear?
They also could be domesticated with bunny foot they would fly above your enemies and dive periodically to deal damage, like phantoms but faster.
Yes please, The eggs should look like turtle eggs but just white, the nest can be collected by shears, when broken, they will just drop sticks.
Who doesn't want this?
This is an incredible idea, would it jump up and down if you're in a slime chunk?
I just had the same idea! I would also definitely make it so that golems and other allied mobs don't attack it so that you can actually keep your smol pet!
also lets off some slime like green water but slow
I like this idea, but how would you tame them? Also, where would you find them. I was thinking maybe the new lush caves or just in flower forests or sunflower fields.

Could we get an enchantment for horse armor to make an existing horse into a Pegasus?  Or add a slot to the horse that would allow the crafting of wings, perhaps out of feathers, diamonds and ender pearls.

I absolutely agree with the conduit simply suffocating the drowned. Basically expanding the effect from close proximity to the conduit, to being anywhere within the conduit's underwater breathing effect area for the player. This would allow players to secure areas near villages or bases from the constant barrage of drowned in nearby water sources. If not outright suffocating them, then perhaps just compelling them to stay underwater?

As for drowned spawning, perhaps they can only spawn on certain underwater blocks. Maybe just gravel? That would reduce the number of locations they could spawn by a good margin, considering dirt and sand make up a good portion of the underwater landscape. Also, gravel because they have that absolutely annoying gravelly gurgling sound they make.

I do like the concept of boosting health regen and/or defenses of pets inside the conduit. That would allow pet axolotls to patrol the waters and take out the unruly drowned. It might even be nice to have the same pets affected by the conduit compelled to stay within the effect area for such patrols, not allowing them to leave that area at all.
for such a great ideas, to bad this feed doesn't have more attention, at this rate were stuck with this nonsense for awhile
Happy animals could make babies on their own! I'd also like to see somewhat of an ecosystem, make the animals feel like living beings instead of walking food.

Totally agree. Animals should work similarly to villagers with their workstations, having certain conditions like access to water, a shelter to rest in when it rains, hay bales nearby, if there is space in their pens etc.

Happiness should go down when they get wet, if they don't have enough space for themselves, if they don't have a shelter to rest in at night or if they get repeatedly bred and killed off.

Maybe you could craft straw bedding out of 2 wheat (like carpets) which happy animals will go over to and rest on so we can mark their beds in shelters etc.

We should be rewarded for taking care of our animals. The current farming method would still work the same way, it's just in the long run, players who take care of their animals will eventually benefit from them.

This idea is brilliant and it allows players to take a more peaceful direction to the game.

This mechanic may not be actionable to any creature big as a wolf, but with anything cat sized or smaller I could definitely see this being both a viable (and useful) mechanic as it would allow players to easily transport smaller livestock.

It would probably occur when the player shifts & right clicks these animals with an empty hand. In order to prevent any logic conflict with breeding them.

The potential victi- I mean applicants, of this system could include:
Baby versions of larger livestock (& tamed wolf pups)
Chickens
Bees
Meerkats
Frogs
Tamed parrots
Tamed cats
Befriended foxes
Befriended ocelots

I only have one thing that I would like to change. That is the part where enchanting tomes are used instead of books. I would prefer if enchanting tables were made the same way, but you could combine an enchanting tome with the enchanting table to make a more powerful enchanting table that lets you enchant things with enchantments that are normally only effects in commands such as blindness, nausea, darkness, etc. My final opinion for this comment, I think that if you combined an enchanting table with an enchanting tome you could get another tab in the enchanting table, but for curses. Please consider this and if you don't like the changes then I can understand. Thx!!!

"you could cook it in a furnace to create a cooked lionfish that would be almost completely safe to eat unlike it's raw version, giving back a neat amount of hunger!"

I think that after the lionfish is cooked it should be completely safe to eat. Because lionfish are venomous, not poisonous, removing the spines would remove the danger. The cooked item texture should have its fins/spines removed similar to cooked cod.
